dashboard.schemesHeaderTitle: Subsidy & Pradhan Mantri schemes for farmers
dashboard.schemesHeaderSubtitle: These schemes can support you when you move towards water-saving, soil-health and risk-protected farming. Scroll through and tap any card for simple eligibility info.
dashboard.clickForDetails: Click to see full details and how to apply
dashboard.sustainabilityHelpText: Many schemes support micro-irrigation, soil testing, crop insurance and direct income support so you can experiment with eco-friendly practices more safely.
dashboard.noteText: Exact guidelines, eligibility and subsidy amounts change over time and differ by state. Always check the latest official information before applying.
dashboard.notSureMethod: Not sure which method fits your farm?
dashboard.startSmall: Start small on one part of your land. For example, try organic compost on one plot, plant a few boundary trees, or keep soil covered after harvest.
dashboard.observeField: Observe your field before making big changes
dashboard.observeText: Notice where water stands, where plants grow better, and which pests come. Good observation makes every sustainable method more effective and less risky.

dashboard.goalSubtitle: Share this dashboard with neighbours or farmer groups, watch one method video together, and discuss which practice is easiest to start this season.

sustainableMethod.title: Sustainable Method
sustainableMethod.description: Organic farming focuses on building healthy soil using compost, crop rotations, and natural pest control instead of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides.
sustainableMethod.highlight: Small and medium farmers are adopting organic practices to get better prices and reduce input costs.
sustainableMethod.whySupportsSustainability: Why this method supports sustainable farming
sustainableMethod.benefit1: Improves soil life and long-term fertility
sustainableMethod.benefit2: Reduces chemical residues in food and water
sustainableMethod.benefit3: Supports insects, birds, and other biodiversity
sustainableMethod.adoptionTrendInfo: How many farmers or acres are using this method over time.
sustainableMethod.sampleTrendNote: This is a sample trend to show how adoption can grow when farmers see benefits in yield, soil health and cost savings.
sustainableMethod.practicalWays: Practical ways you can start using this method
sustainableMethod.practice1: Replace synthetic NPK with compost, farmyard manure, and green manures.
sustainableMethod.practice2: Rotate cereals with legumes like moong or gram to fix nitrogen naturally.
sustainableMethod.practice3: Use neem, chilli-garlic sprays, and traps instead of broad-spectrum pesticides.
sustainableMethod.startSmallAdvice: You do not have to change everything at once. Start on one field or one season, observe the results, and then slowly scale up.
sustainableMethod.watchVideo: Watch a short video about this method
sustainableMethod.openVideoInfo: Open this video to see real-life examples and simple explanations.
sustainableMethod.watchTogetherNote: Try watching it with other farmers and discuss what can work in your area this year.
